item.title: [GROOVY-6200] Ant groovyc throws a NoClassDefFoundError compiling a groovy class with @DelegatesTo and @CompileStatic
item.description:
I attached a sample project. The offending class is shown below. For some reason passing the closure inline triggers the error. The error goes away if I remove @CompileStatic, or declare the closure variable before passing it into method2. It also does not occur when compiling in IDEA, only with Ant.

The error itself is easy to work around, but very difficult to identify since there is nothing in the error indicating what code triggered it.

@groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class MyClass {
    void method1() {
        method2({})
    }

    void method2(@DelegatesTo(strategy = Closure.DELEGATE_FIRST, value = String) Closure body) {

    }
}

comments.comment:
As a workaround, you can use:

        <groovyc destdir="${classes.dir}"
                 srcdir="${src.dir}"
                 classpathref="groovy.path"
                 fork="true" includeAntRuntime="false">
I pushed a fix for this, if you can give it a try, it would be great!

Would love to use fork="true", but unfortunately the groovyc task seems to fail with long classpaths when forking so that doesn't work for our project.

Just tried the latest snapshot and the error went away.
